DOC.brief_summary: This first randomize control study compare robot-assisted thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy ( RATE ) minimally invasive conventional thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy ( CTLE ) . The aim trial evaluate safety , risk robot-assisted esophagectomy , compare short-term operative outcome long-term oncological outcome two surgical treatment .
DOC.brief_title: Robot-assisted Thoraco-laparoscopic Esophagectomy Versus Minimally Invasive Conventional Thoraco-laparoscopic Esophagectomy
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : This study aim compare oncological outcome robot-assisted thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy minimally invasive conventional thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy . Study design : Randomized control parallel-group superiority trial Study population : Patients ( age > = 18 < = 75 year ) histologically prove surgically resectable ( cT1-4a , N0-3 , M0 ) squamous cell carcinoma intrathoracic esophagus Karnofsky score 80 . Intervention : 300 patient randomly allocate either A ) robot-assisted thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy ( n=150 ) B ) minimally invasive conventional thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy ( n=150 ) . Patients receive follow intervention : Group A. Robot-assisted thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy , gastric conduit formation . Group B. minimally invasive conventional thoraco-laparoscopic esophagectomy , gastric conduit formation . Main study parameters/endpoints : Primary outcome 5-year overall survival rate 5-year disease free survival rate . Secondary outcomes 3-year overall survival rate , 3-year disease free survival , ( hospital ) mortality within 30 60 day , R0 resection , operation related event , postoperative recovery , lymph node status , quality life . Follow-up : 60 month randomization .
